title: How to Earn XP and Level Up Fast in Fortnite Chapter 4

steps.title: Finish daily quests for XP.
steps.content: Finish daily quests for XP. Daily quests refresh every day at 6 AM PST/9 AM EST/2 PM GMT. These quests are similar to weekly quests, though the tasks can be done a lot quicker. These quests may look like: restoring shields, upgrading weapons, visiting landmarks, and more. If you play Fortnite daily, be sure to complete at least the first three daily quests; each quest onward will have a reduced XP reward amount.

steps.title: Finish weekly quests.
steps.content: Finish weekly quests. Every Tuesday, Fortnite adds new challenges you can complete during matches. These weekly challenges range from tasks like dealing a certain amount of damage to riding a mount or catching fish. Unlike daily quests, these quests won't be refreshed for an entire week, so you have time to complete them for the rewards.

steps.title: Party Assist can help you finish quests more quickly.
steps.content: Party Assist can help you finish quests more quickly. When you play with friends in Fortnite matches, they can help get progress on your daily and weekly quests with the Party Assist feature. If you have quests that are about to expire, play Duos, Trios, or Squads to get a helping hand.

steps.title: Milestones give you XP for achievements.
steps.content: Milestones give you XP for achievements. Similar to quests, milestones give you XP as a reward for completing them. Milestones have tasks separated by Challenge, Combat, and Exploration tasks, and these tasks usually take a number of matches to fully complete. For example, you may need to destroy 250 objects, inflict 2,000 damage to opponents, travel 7,500 meters, and more.

steps.title: Use Fortnite's Creative mode to farm XP.
steps.content: Use Fortnite's Creative mode to farm XP. You can find these modes in the Discover tab. Popular modes include "OnlyUp Fortnite", which gives you XP as you use objects to climb as high as you can. These modes can offer a break from battling, so be sure to take advantage of them. As a paid option, you can play Save the World , which is a PvE zombie shooter-like mode. [1] X Research source This rewards up to 450,000 XP per day (about 6 levels), so you can play this mode to gain steady levels. You can even play this mode in Co-Op, so you and your squad can level up together.

steps.title: Win Battle Royale to get tons of XP.
steps.content: Win Battle Royale to get tons of XP. This is the easiest, guaranteed way to get levels quickly. With every storm cycle you survive, the XP bonuses increase. Additionally, getting eliminations can give you tons of XP, so even if you don't win the match, you'll receive a hefty amount of XP with your end-game stats. If you don't have a squad to play with, there are ways to improve your skill and win a game solo .

steps.title: Buy extra levels in the Fortnite shop.
steps.content: Buy extra levels in the Fortnite shop. If the season is ending and you're nearing the end of the Battle Pass, you may need to purchase the last few levels if you don't have time to grind. Luckily, if you're close to the end of the Battle Pass, Fortnite gives a discounted price for levels.
